Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bowl
Description: Bowl with a flat base, hemispherical body, restricted mouth and a simple lip. This vessel bears interesting characteristics: the rim was pinched in order to shape the orifice like an oval and to form a spout. The entire vessel was dipped into a golden mica slip, creating a resemblance to some Classic Kerma ceramics and the singular production of the Second Cataract region, the ''golden ware''.
